poem:
"Playground of Bureaucrats"

Behind stern walls of glass and stone,
to and fro civil servants drone.
Sarah quietly carries on,
caught in the public eye's scorn.
Amidst the battle of power grows,
a discontented aura throws.
Speak the truth, Sarah dear,
In the face of constraining fear.
In the world's vast, complex design,
even postmasters must toe the line.
